{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20743v1", "title": "Nonsymmorphic Topological Phases of Non-Hermitian Systems", "summary": "Non-Hermiticity appears ubiquitously in various open classical and quantum
systems and enriches classification of topological phases. However, the role of
nonsymmorphic symmetry, crystalline symmetry accompanying fractional lattice
translations, has remained largely unexplored. Here, we systematically classify
non-Hermitian topological crystalline phases protected by nonsymmorphic
symmetry and reveal unique phases that have no counterparts in either Hermitian
topological crystalline phases or non-Hermitian topological phases protected
solely by internal symmetry. Specifically, we elucidate the $\mathbb{Z}_2$ and
$\mathbb{Z}_4$ non-Hermitian topological phases and their associated anomalous
boundary states characterized by distinctive complex-valued energy dispersions.", "main_category": "cond-mat.mes-hall", "categories": "cond-mat.mes-hall,math-ph,math.MP,quant-ph", "published": "2025-04-29T13:24:24Z"}
